document_data.name: Knights of the Vigil
document_data.mainbody: The '''Knights of the Vigil''' was an order of [[Helmite]] knights that were tasked with the oversight and maintenance of [[Watcher's Keep]], a powerful mortal prison designed to imprison evil beings at behest of [[Helm]] himself.
document_data.Activities: The sole purpose of the Vigil was to ensure that the [[Imprisoned One]] was sealed away deep beneath Watcher's Keep. The supremely evil being was never to be freed, lest it bring chaos and destruction upon the world, nor slain, as it would be released from bondage and returned to its domain in the [[Abyss]].
document_data.Base of Operations: The knights were dedicated to the preservation of Watcher's Keep in western [[Tethyr]]. While the topmost level of the keep was a dedicated temple to Helm, it was unknown if that is where the knights kept their residence.
document_data.Relationships: Unlike other well-known Helmite orders, such as the [[Vigilant Eyes of the God]] or the [[Watchers over the Fallen]], the Knights of the vigil were rather secretive in nature.
document_data.History:
The order was founded during the [[Time of Troubles]], in the {{YearlinkName|1358}}. When the [[avatar]]s of the [[Faerûnian pantheon]] were set to walk the Realms of [[Faerûn]], the [[magic]]al ''[[ward]]s'' found deep within the keep began to falter.

As [[Helm]] was the only being to retain his divinity at that time, he called upon a group of his knights and swore them to an oath that designated their role as guardians of Watcher's Keep, and the Imprisoned One trapped within. The knights had to perform a specific [[ritual]] every so often, sacrificing their lives in order to maintain the keep's wards and prevent the Imprisoned One from wreaking havoc across [[Toril]].

The knights' dedication to their oath waned over the next decade. In the {{YearlinkName|1369}}, the knights' leader [[Odren]] chose not to continue with their tradition, and deceptively called out for any [[adventurer]]s who were willing to perform the ritual in their stead. He and his knights gave no inclination about the sacrifice needed to perform the ritual, and concocted a flimsy story about how his order were too weak to defeat the horrors that overran the keep's upper levels.
document_data.Members: The group comprised various knights, [[cleric]]s, and even [[mage]]s dedicated to the worship and dogma of Helm.
